Email traffic containing links to known.Data: Zeek smtp.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek conn.log
Email traffic containing links to known.Action: Analyze Zeek smtp.log for emails containing URLs. Extract URLs and compare against threat intelligence feeds of known malicious sites. Analyze Zeek http.log/conn.log for connections originating from internal hosts to external IPs matching threat intel or associated with suspicious URLs found in emails. Use frequency analysis of URLs or entropy calculations on URL strings to identify unusual link patterns.

Emails with spoofed sender addresses or.Action: Analyze Zeek smtp.log for email headers. Extract 'From', 'Return-Path', 'Received' headers. Check SPF and DKIM status if available in logs. Identify emails where the 'From' domain does not align with the 'Return-Path' or originating server, or where SPF/DKIM fail. Calculate sender domain entropy or use statistical analysis on sender behavior to flag anomalies.

Execution of potentially malicious file.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for process creation on endpoints. Correlate process executions with file paths originating from typical email attachment download locations (e.g., Downloads folder). Filter for file extensions commonly used for malicious purposes (e.g., .docm, .xlsm, .exe, .js, .vbs, .zip containing these) and analyze parent-child process relationships. Use frequency analysis to identify rare processes launched from these locations.

Suspicious network connections originati.Data: Zeek conn.log; Zeek http.log; Zeek dns.log
Suspicious network connections originati.Action: Analyze Zeek conn.log and http.log for external connections initiated by internal users shortly after receiving emails containing URLs (correlating with smtp.log). Identify connections to IPs/domains not typically visited by the user/host or associated with suspicious characteristics (e.g., high-numbered ports, use of uncommon protocols). Use descriptive statistics (e.g., count of new domains visited, frequency of specific ports) to profile normal user web activity and flag significant deviations. Analyze DNS queries (Zeek dns.log) for resolution of suspicious domains found in emails.
